actus-demo/demo-user-guide.title: Companion User Guide
actus-demo/demo-user-guide.description: This document provides guidance to a user of the ACTUS demonstrations:

actus-demo/server-curl-samples.title: ACTUS Server cURL Samples
actus-demo/server-curl-samples.description: This document presents the formatted cURL command samples to interact with the ACTUS server for cash flow simulations. These samples demonstrate how to structure the requests and include necessary headers and payloads.

awesome-actus-lib/architecture.title: Library Architecture
awesome-actus-lib/architecture.description: The Awesome ACTUS Library is built on a clear design principle:

awesome-actus-lib/classes/ActusService.title: ActusService
awesome-actus-lib/classes/ActusService.description: The ActusService class is the core controller interface for generating ACTUS-compliant event schedules.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/Analysis.title: AnalysisLayer
awesome-actus-lib/classes/Analysis.description: The Analysis Layer provides a modular system for interpreting ACTUS contract simulation results.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/cashflowstream.title: CashFlowStream
awesome-actus-lib/classes/cashflowstream.description: The CashFlowStream class encapsulates the result of simulating ACTUS contracts under a given risk factor scenario. It is the central object produced by the generateEvents() method of the ACTUS service.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/contractModel.title: ContractModel
awesome-actus-lib/classes/contractModel.description: The ContractModel class is the abstract base for all ACTUS contract types in the Awesome Actus Library. It defines the structure, validation, and lifecycle behavior of ACTUS-conformant financial contracts such as PAM, ANN, LAM, etc.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/PAM.title: PAM
awesome-actus-lib/classes/PAM.description: Principal At Maturity (PAM) is a standard ACTUS contract type implemented in the Awesome Actus Library.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/Portfolio.title: Portfolio
awesome-actus-lib/classes/Portfolio.description: The Portfolio class represents a collection of ACTUS contracts, such as PAM, ANN, or other contract types. It allows you to batch contracts into a group for simulation or analysis.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/riskfactor.title: RiskFactor
awesome-actus-lib/classes/riskfactor.description: The RiskFactor module in the Awesome ACTUS Library provides a structured and extensible interface for representing time-dependent market data used in ACTUS contract simulation and valuation.

awesome-actus-lib/classes/RiskService.title: RiskService
awesome-actus-lib/classes/RiskService.description: The RiskService class enables management of external market data scenarios and reference indexes. It is used when contracts rely on externalized risk factors instead of inline parameters.

competition.title: ACTUS Competition Pre-Announcement
competition.description: The ACTUS Financial Research Foundation (“ACTUS Foundation”, http://www.ACTUSfrf.org ) is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization providing freely available fully integrated financial contract standard comprised of two fundamental components that describe the data formats and algorithms common to all financial contracts. Financial contracts are basic building blocks for finance, including cash flow agreements, risk analysis and nearly all financial reports. Standardized contract term specification and cash flow generating algorithms provide a basis for all further financial analysis. In particular, the ACTUS Standard facilitates forward-looking “what if” analysis, the ability to consistently and accurately consolidate financial contract information across business units of a firm or across financial institutions, flexible and robust data aggregation, and the generation of financial reports capable of drilling down to the most granular financial contract level for any number of future scenarios. This significantly improves the understanding of both risks and opportunities.

dadfir3-demo/About.title: Data-Driven Financial Risk and Regulatory Reporting (DaDFiR3)

dadfir3-demo/ACTUS Rshiny Demo Guide.title: ACTUS Rshiny Demo Guide
dadfir3-demo/ACTUS Rshiny Demo Guide.description: This guide will help you install and use the ACTUS Rshiny Demo. This demo is a reactive Rshiny application that allows you to run ACTUS cash flow simulations on a single contract or on a portfolio of contracts using a selected interest rate risk scenario. When simulating a portfolio, you can select whether the results should be summarized as a plot of generated profits or liquidity balance and whether this should be a month-by-month or an accumulated plot.

dadfir3-demo/Demo User Guide.title: Guide to ACTUS Portfolio Interest Rate Risk Analysis

examples/advanced-examples/portfolioExam.title: Analysis Example: Multi-Contract Portfolio Analysis
examples/advanced-examples/portfolioExam.description: This example demonstrates how to model, simulate, and analyze a portfolio of fixed-rate and floating-rate ACTUS contracts using the Awesome Actus Library (AAL).

examples/advanced-examples/singleContrac.title: Analysis Example: Variable Rate Annuity Contract
examples/advanced-examples/singleContrac.description: This end-to-end example demonstrates how to define, simulate, and analyze a variable-rate Annuity (ANN) contract using the Awesome Actus Library (AAL).

examples/advanced-examples/VaR_example.title: Simulating Value-at-Risk (VaR) for a Single PAM Contract
examples/advanced-examples/VaR_example.description: This example illustrates how to simulate multiple interest rate scenarios and evaluate the Value-at-Risk (VaR) of a fixed-rate ACTUS PAM contract using the Awesome Actus Library (AAL).

getting-started/basic-usage.title: Basic Usage
getting-started/basic-usage.description: This guide walks you through defining and simulating a basic ACTUS contract using the awesomeactuslib library.

getting-started/configuration.title: Configuration
getting-started/configuration.description: You can manually configure the ActusService and RiskService to connect to your own hosted services. This is especially important in production environments, since the public services are intended only for demonstration and testing purposes.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: You can install Awesome Actus Library directly from PyPI using pip — no need to clone any repositories.

guides/common-patterns.title: Common Patterns
guides/common-patterns.description: Best practices and idiomatic usage in Awesome ACTUS Library.

guides/troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
guides/troubleshooting.description: This page lists common issues users may encounter while using the Awesome ACTUS Library and how to resolve them.

intro.title: Welcome to ACTUS Documentation
intro.description: Welcome to the comprehensive documentation for the ACTUS (Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards) framework. This documentation will guide you through understanding, implementing, and working with ACTUS financial contracts.

Introduction/Benefits of ACTUS.title: Benefits
Introduction/Benefits of ACTUS.description: Key Advantages of the ACTUS Standard

Introduction/Model-for-analytics.title: Analytics Model
Introduction/Model-for-analytics.description: This enhanced model provides a step-by-step approach to understanding financial contracts. Starting with risk factors and contract details, it tracks the flow of events and expected cash flows, ultimately leading to analytical results. These results help financial institutions manage risks, predict outcomes, and make informed decisions in a complex financial environment.

Introduction/Overview.title: Overview
Introduction/Overview.description: In the financial world, institutions like banks and investment firms keep track of their financial status using balance sheets. A balance sheet is like a snapshot that shows what the institution owns (assets), what it owes (liabilities), and other financial commitments it has made, known as financial contracts.

RiskFactors/Improvements/extensions.title: Possible Improvements And Extensions
RiskFactors/Improvements/extensions.description: The ACTUS Quickstart installation provides a simplified path for a new ACTUS user to quickly set up an ACTUS service in their workstation environment and explore the potential of ACTUS technology using:

RiskFactors/overview/overview.title: Risk Factors and ACTUS Simulation Script
RiskFactors/overview/overview.description: Here we describe a script sequence of commands which:

RiskFactors/Risk modelling/activating_be.title: Activating the Model for Simulation
RiskFactors/Risk modelling/activating_be.description: Once a prepayment behavior model is included in a risk scenario, individual contracts must specify which behavior models to activate during simulation.

RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Distinguishin.title: Market Risk vs. Behavior Risk
RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Distinguishin.description: ACTUS simulations can run under two different scenarios:

RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Example_of_co.title: Contract Behavior Risk Models
RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Example_of_co.description: In earlier sections, we discussed market risk, where all contracts in a simulation experience the same projected market values, leading to consistent and aggregatable cash flows and events. However, real-world financial contracts are also influenced by contract-specific and counterparty behaviors, introducing additional uncertainty.

RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Output.title: Sample Contract Simulation
RiskFactors/Risk modelling/Output.description: Here We Simulate Principal At Maturity (PAM) loan contracts with risk factors to analyze borrower payment patterns and cash flow impacts.

RiskFactors/Risk modelling/sample_2d_pay.title: Setting Up a Sample
RiskFactors/Risk modelling/sample_2d_pay.description: The actus-riskservice-ce component in ACTUS Quickstart includes a sample two-dimensional prepayment behavior risk model for analyzing prepayment risks in loan contracts.

RiskFactors/Simulating an ACTUS contract.title: Contract Simulation
RiskFactors/Simulating an ACTUS contract.description: Now that we have defined ACTUS contracts, let's simulate their cash flows under a market risk scenario using ACTUS Quickstart.

RiskFactors/Using mongodb ACTUS risk dat.title: Initialize Risk Factor Store in MongoDB

standard/core-concepts.title: Core Concepts of ACTUS
standard/core-concepts.description: The ACTUS Standard is built around a set of core concepts that define how financial contracts are represented, interpreted, and simulated. These concepts are designed to ensure clarity, consistency, and automation in modeling financial instruments.
